alert.note: Alert for Inland Kenedy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:58PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kenedy and northeastern Brooks Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 457 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near U S 77 Border Patrol Station, or 10 miles north of Armstrong, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Armstrong, Sarita, U S 77 Border Patrol Station, Kenedy County Sheriffs Office and Armstrong Ranch Airport. This includes US Highway 77 between mile markers 710 and 736. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
